history.content:
If you’re an undergrad they won’t let you enroll in 259 since 159 is an option, similarly to how undergrads can’t enroll in CS 289.

---

As a side note, 259 is the same class as 159, but with a research project attached instead of a final. Therefore, if Prof Bamman lets you in 259 instead of telling you to just take 159, it would be pretty easy to appeal this to the advisors.
If you’re an undergrad they won’t let you enroll in 259 since 159 is an option, similarly to how undergrads can’t enroll in CS 289.

On the department website (https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs-upperdiv), it states that "Info 159 and STAT/DATA/CS C100 are the only non CS/EE/EECS titled classes that may be used to fulfill [the upper division CS] requirement" for undergraduates. I looked at https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/special-topics-courses to see if INFO 259 would fulfill an upper division CS requirement, but it is unfortunately not listed here because it is not offered through the CS department. Will INFO 259 fulfill the respective upper division requirement that INFO 159 fulfills? Thanks!

Also, I know that CS 288 is being offered next semester, but given my schedule, I won't be able to enroll in it. :(
history.subject: INFO 259 for Upper Division CS Requirement
